body.description: This pre-owned or refurbished product has been professionally inspected and tested to work and look like new. How a product becomes part of Amazon Renewed, your destination for pre-owned, refurbished products: A customer buys a new product and returns it or trades it in for a newer or different model. That product is inspected and tested to work and look like new by Amazon-qualified suppliers. Then, the product is sold as an Amazon Renewed product on Amazon. If not satisfied with the purchase, renewed products are eligible for replacement or refund under the Amazon Renewed Guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased with this GPU and the service
reviews.reviewText: Built this computer as a gift to my daughter-in-law and was trying to keep the parts cost to a minimum. This card was advertised as "refurbished" so I was somewhat cautious and didn't know for sure what to expect.Card arrived a day earlier than expected and upon opening the Amazon packaging I found the Power Color box to still be in it's original shrink-wrap, unopened. I was very happy to see that. Everything inside the box confirmed that it had never been opening. I got a new GPU for the price of a refurbished one, nice!I paired this Power Color RX580 Red Devil GPU with a Ryzen-5 2600 CPU and ASUS B350-F Gaming motherboard, along with a 500GB SSD for the boot drive and a 2TB HDD for storage. All was placed in a NZXT H500i case with white power cable extensions and a Rosewill Photon 650 80+ Gold PSU.Works wonderfully! Not overclocking the GPU or CPU because I want it to be 100% stable for her. She plays WOW and SWTOR with my son and she couldn't be happier with the build. Will have no hesitation to order from StallionTek again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I ordered one of these cards, slapped it in place of my RX 570, and now my entire BIOS has been reset, lost all settings, and the system enters lockup upon booting up the BIOS and then resets and will run indefinitely without loading the BIOS at the f*** all, worthless seller trying to scam hard working Americans out of their money

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Random artifacts and glitches
reviews.reviewText: Out of the box, this card was working perfectly fine, but after installing it in my PC less than 5 hours ago, I started to get really random artifacting in certain games(Vermintide 2 and GTA V) where if I tried minimizing the game and reopening the tab, the entire monitor screen would basically look like a kaleidoscope of artifacts and odd colors. Keep in mind, the card was working fine all day, UNTIL, I overclocked it from stock 1380Mhz Core to 1400Mhz and the memory from 2000Mhz to 2050Mhz and had the BIOs switched obviously selected to "OC" mode on the card itself. As of this exact moment, I currently have the BIOS switch set to "SILENT" mode and all the clock speeds are set to stock. I'm gonna run some more tests to see if it was just my overclock but I'm unfortunately expecting and dreading the worse, that the card itself is screwed, because never in my life have I ever seen a card artifact so badly from a +20 and +50 overclock offset. I am giving this card 3 stars, primarily because when it works, it works extremely well, but also because I'm not entirely sure how stable my particular card is or how much longer its gonna even last in my system. I just hope customer support takes pity on me and makes the RMA process nice and smooth if/when I inevitably have to return it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
reviews.reviewText: i chose this gpu after seeing a LOT of good things about it online for my first build. the card has been great in every aspect. i play games like rust, apex, cs go, siege, etc, and on most games i’ve been running anywhere from 75-130 fps. the temps can get a little high if you don’t have enough fans. after flipping the overclock switch to silent mode, i’ve noticed a significant temp drop while under load. typically, i would be around 70-75* C, now i’m right around 65-70* C. great card for the money, even refurbished.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s a steal
reviews.reviewText: It runs above average and gives a clear boost in frames. For the price you can’t beat the RX580 so it’s a nice grab for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
reviews.reviewText: It was amazing that it can take apex legends and the division 2 on well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
reviews.reviewText: I was not lucky enough to get a card that functioned properly. The card would crash midway through most games. Contacted support for help and was directed to get a new power supply as mine seemed ill equipped to do the job. I got a new psu and still was confronted with crashing. Am returning. Hopefully will have better luck next time. Support was informative and there for me. Just is not much to do with a malfunctioning card.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019
reviews.reviewText: This card is perfect for 1080p 144hz. Handles everything I throw at it. A great buy!
